segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 44
segments.en: Linked Discourses 44

segments.pli: 1. Abyākatavagga
segments.en: 1. The Undeclared Points

segments.pli: 6. Catutthasāriputtakoṭṭhikasutta
segments.en: 6. With Sāriputta and Koṭṭhita (4th)

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā ca sāriputto, āyasmā ca mahākoṭṭhiko bārāṇasiyaṃ viharanti isipatane migadāye.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā sāriputto sāyanhasamayaṃ paṭisallānā vuṭṭhito yenāyasmā mahākoṭṭhiko tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākoṭṭhikena saddhiṃ sammodi.
segments.en: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of retreat, went to Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita, and they greeted each other.

segments.pli: Sammodanīyaṃ kathaṃ sāraṇīyaṃ vītisāretvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā sāriputto āyasmantaṃ mahākoṭṭhikaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to Mahākoṭṭhita:

segments.pli: “‘kiṃ nu kho, āvuso koṭṭhika, hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti … pe …
segments.en: “Reverend Koṭṭhita, does a Realized One exist after death?” …

segments.pli: ‘kiṃ panāvuso, neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti iti puṭṭho samāno:
segments.en: “Reverend, when asked these questions, you say that this has not been declared by the Buddha.

segments.pli: ‘etampi kho, āvuso, abyākataṃ bhagavatā—
neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’ti vadesi.
Ko nu kho, āvuso, hetu, ko paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: What’s the cause, what’s the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Rūpārāmassa kho, āvuso, rūparatassa rūpasammuditassa rūpanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
segments.en: “Reverend, if you like, love, and enjoy form, and don’t truly see the cessation of form, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ or

segments.pli: ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
segments.en: ‘a Realized One doesn’t exist after death’ or

segments.pli: ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti;
segments.en: ‘a Realized One both exists and doesn’t exist after death’ or

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Vedanārāmassa kho, āvuso, vedanāratassa vedanāsammuditassa, vedanānirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you like, love, and enjoy feeling …

segments.pli: saññārāmassa kho, āvuso … pe …
segments.en: perception …

segments.pli: saṅkhārārāmassa kho āvuso … pe …
segments.en: choices …

segments.pli: viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, viññāṇaratassa viññāṇasammuditassa viññāṇanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: consciousness, and don’t truly see the cessation of consciousness, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Na rūpārāmassa kho, āvuso, na rūparatassa na rūpasammuditassa, rūpanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy form …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
Na vedanārāmassa kho, āvuso … pe …
segments.en: feeling …

segments.pli: na saññārāmassa kho, āvuso … pe …
segments.en: perception …

segments.pli: na saṅkhārārāmassa kho, āvuso … pe …
segments.en: choices …

segments.pli: na viññāṇārāmassa kho, āvuso, na viññāṇaratassa na viññāṇasammuditassa, viññāṇanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: consciousness, and you truly see the cessation of consciousness, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho, āvuso, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: This is the cause, this is the reason why this has not been declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Siyā, āvuso.
segments.en: “There could, reverend.

segments.pli: Bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, bhavaratassa bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you like, love, and enjoy existence, and don’t truly see the cessation of continued existence, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Na bhavārāmassa kho, āvuso, na bhavaratassa na bhavasammuditassa, bhavanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy existence, and you truly see the cessation of continued existence, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Siyā, āvuso.
segments.en: “There could, reverend.

segments.pli: Upādānārāmassa kho, āvuso, upādānaratassa upādānasammuditassa, upādānanirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you like, love, and enjoy grasping, and don’t truly see the cessation of grasping, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Na upādānārāmassa kho, āvuso, na upādānaratassa na upādānasammuditassa, upādānanirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy grasping, and you truly see the cessation of grasping, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva, hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Siyā, āvuso.
segments.en: “There could, reverend.

segments.pli: Taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, taṇhāratassa taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṃ ajānato apassato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you like, love, and enjoy craving, and don’t truly see the cessation of craving, you think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Na taṇhārāmassa kho, āvuso, na taṇhāratassa na taṇhāsammuditassa, taṇhānirodhaṃ jānato passato yathābhūtaṃ, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti … pe …
segments.en: If you don’t like, love, and enjoy craving, and you truly see the cessation of craving, you don’t think ‘a Realized One exists after death’ …

segments.pli: ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṃ maraṇā’tipissa na hoti.
segments.en: ‘a Realized One neither exists nor doesn’t exist after death.’

segments.pli: Ayampi kho, āvuso, pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti.
segments.en: This too is a way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha.”

segments.pli: “Siyā panāvuso, aññopi pariyāyo, yenetaṃ abyākataṃ bhagavatā”ti?
segments.en: “But reverend, could there be another way of explaining why this was not declared by the Buddha?”

segments.pli: “Ettha dāni, āvuso sāriputta, ito uttari kiṃ icchasi?
segments.en: “Seriously, reverend, what more could you want?

segments.pli: Taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttassa, āvuso sāriputta, bhikkhuno vaṭṭaṃ natthi paññāpanāyā”ti.
segments.en: For one who is freed due to the ending of craving, there is no cycle of rebirths to be found.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.

sections.title: At one time Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita were…

suttaplex.blurb: Sāriputta asks Mahākoṭṭhita whether a Realized One exists after death. Mahākoṭṭhita says that only someone who delights in the five aggregates would think in such terms, and offers a variety of further explanations of the same point.
